verses.verse: How does the city <WH5892> sit <WH3427> solitary <WH910>, that was full <WH7227> of people <WH5971>! how is she become as a widow <WH490>! she that was great <WH7227> among the nations <WH1471>, and princess <WH8282> among the provinces <WH4082>, how is she become tributary <WH4522>!

She weeps <WH1058> severely <WH1058> in the night <WH3915>, and her tears <WH1832> are on her cheeks <WH3895>: among all her lovers <WH157> she has none to comfort <WH5162> her <WH7453>: all her friends have dealt treacherously <WH898> with her <WH341>, they are become her enemies.

Judah <WH3063> is gone into captivity <WH1540> because of affliction <WH6040>, and because of great <WH7230> servitude <WH5656>: she dwells <WH3427> among the heathen <WH1471>, she finds <WH4672> no rest <WH4494>: all her persecutors <WH7291> overtook <WH5381> her between the straits <WH4712>.

The ways <WH1870> of Zion <WH6726> do mourn <WH57>, because none come <WH935> to the solemn feasts <WH4150>: all her gates <WH8179> are desolate <WH8074>: her priests <WH3548> sigh <WH584>, her virgins <WH1330> are afflicted <WH3013>, and she is in bitterness <WH4843>.

Her adversaries <WH6862> are the chief <WH7218>, her enemies <WH341> prosper <WH7951>; for the Lord <WH3068> has afflicted <WH3013> her for the multitude <WH7230> of her transgressions <WH6588>: her sons <WH5768> are gone <WH1980> into captivity <WH7628> before <WH6440> the enemy <WH6862>.

And from the daughter <WH1323> of Zion <WH6726> all her beauty <WH1926> is departed <WH3318>: her princes <WH8269> are become like harts <WH354> that find <WH4672> no pasture <WH4829>, and they are gone <WH3212> without strength <WH3581> before <WH6440> the pursuer <WH7291>.

Jerusalem <WH3389> remembered <WH2142> in the days <WH3117> of her affliction <WH6040> and of her miseries <WH4788> all her pleasant things <WH4262> that she had in the days <WH3117> of old <WH6924>, when her people <WH5971> fell <WH5307> into the hand <WH3027> of the enemy <WH6862>, and none did help <WH5826> her <WH6862>: the adversaries saw <WH7200> her <WH7832>, and did mock at her sabbaths <WH4868>.

Jerusalem <WH3389> has grievously <WH2399> sinned <WH2398>; therefore she is removed <WH5206>: all that honored <WH3513> her despise <WH2107> her <WH7200>, because they have seen her nakedness <WH6172>: Yes <WH584>, she sighs, and turns <WH7725> backward <WH268>.

Her filthiness <WH2932> is in her skirts <WH7757>; she remembers <WH2142> not her last end <WH319>; therefore she came down <WH3381> wonderfully <WH6382>: she had no comforter <WH5162>. O Lord <WH3068>, behold <WH7200> my affliction <WH6040>: for the enemy <WH341> has magnified himself <WH1431>.

The adversary <WH6862> has spread out <WH6566> his hand <WH3027> upon all her pleasant things <WH4261>: for she has seen <WH7200> that the heathen <WH1471> entered <WH935> into her sanctuary <WH4720>, whom you did command <WH6680> that they should not enter <WH935> into your congregation <WH6951>.

All her people <WH5971> sigh <WH584>, they seek <WH1245> bread <WH3899>; they have given <WH5414> their pleasant things <WH4261> for food <WH400> to relieve <WH7725> the soul <WH5315>: see <WH7200>, O Lord <WH3068>, and consider <WH5027>; for I am become vile <WH2151>.

Is it nothing to you <WH5674>, all you that pass by <WH1870>? behold <WH5027>, and see <WH7200> if there be <WH3426> any sorrow <WH4341> like unto my sorrow <WH4341>, which is done <WH5953> unto me <WH3068>, with which the Lord has afflicted <WH3013> me in the day <WH3117> of his fierce <WH2740> anger <WH639>.

From above <WH4791> has he sent <WH7971> fire <WH784> into my bones <WH6106>, and it prevails <WH7287> against them <WH6566>: he has spread a net <WH7568> for my feet <WH7272>, he has turned <WH7725> me back <WH268>: he has made <WH5414> me desolate <WH8074> and faint <WH1739> all the day <WH3117>.

The yoke <WH5923> of my transgressions <WH6588> is bound <WH8244> by his hand <WH3027>: they are wreathed <WH8276>, and come up <WH5927> upon my neck <WH6677>: he has made my strength <WH3581> to fall <WH3782>, the Lord <WH136> has delivered <WH5414> me into their hands <WH3027>, from whom I am not able <WH3201> to rise up <WH6965>.

The Lord <WH136> has trodden under foot <WH5541> all my mighty <WH47> men in the midst <WH7130> of me <WH7121>: he has called a assembly <WH4150> against me to crush <WH7665> my young men <WH970>: the Lord <WH136> has trodden <WH1869> the virgin <WH1330>, the daughter <WH1323> of Judah <WH3063>, as in a winepress <WH1660>.

For these things I weep <WH1058>; my eye <WH5869>, my eye <WH5869> runs down <WH3381> with water <WH4325>, because the comforter <WH5162> that should relieve <WH7725> my soul <WH5315> is far <WH7368> from me <WH1121>: my sons are desolate <WH8074>, because the enemy <WH341> prevailed <WH1396>.

Zion <WH6726> spreads forth <WH6566> her hands <WH3027>, and there is none to comfort <WH5162> her <WH3068>: the Lord has commanded <WH6680> concerning Jacob <WH3290>, that his adversaries <WH6862> should be round about <WH5439> him <WH3389>: Jerusalem is as a menstruous woman among them <WH5079>.

The Lord <WH3068> is righteous <WH6662>; for I have rebelled <WH4784> against his commandment <WH6310>: hear <WH8085>, I pray you <WH5971>, all people, and behold <WH7200> my sorrow <WH4341>: my virgins <WH1330> and my young men <WH970> are gone <WH1980> into captivity <WH7628>.

I called <WH7121> for my lovers <WH157>, but they deceived <WH7411> me <WH3548>: my priests and my elders <WH2205> gave up the Spirit <WH1478> in the city <WH5892>, while they sought <WH1245> their food <WH400> to relieve <WH7725> their souls <WH5315>.

Behold <WH7200>, O Lord <WH3068>; for I am in distress <WH6887>: my bowels <WH4578> are troubled <WH2560>; my heart <WH3820> is turned <WH2015> inside <WH7130> me <WH4784>; for I have grievously rebelled <WH4784>: abroad <WH2351> the sword <WH2719> bereaves <WH7921>, at home <WH1004> there is as death <WH4194>.

They have heard <WH8085> that I sigh <WH584>: there is none to comfort <WH5162> me <WH341>: all my enemies have heard <WH8085> of my trouble <WH7451>; they are glad <WH7797> that you have done <WH6213> it <WH935>: you will bring the day <WH3117> that you have called <WH7121>, and they shall be like unto me <WH3644>.

Let all their wickedness <WH7451> come <WH935> before <WH6440> you <WH5953>; and do unto them <WH5953>, as you have done unto me for all my transgressions <WH6588>: for my sighs <WH585> are many <WH7227>, and my heart <WH3820> is faint <WH1742>.
